passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Linus Pauling was an American scientist who won two Nobel Prizes. • Pauling was awarded the 1954 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his research on the nature of the chemical bond. • He also received the 1962 Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts to promote nuclear disarmament. • Pauling's advocacy for disarmament made him a controversial figure during the Cold War.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to highlight Linus Pauling's unique accomplishments?

choices.A: Linus Pauling was an American scientist known for his controversial views on nuclear disarmament.
choices.B: Linus Pauling, an American scientist, uniquely won both the Nobel Prize in Chemistry and the Nobel Peace Prize.
choices.C: Linus Pauling was awarded the 1954 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his research on chemical bonds.
choices.D: Linus Pauling's work in chemistry and his advocacy for disarmament made him famous during the Cold War.

explanation: B: 'Linus Pauling, an American scientist, uniquely won both the Nobel Prize in Chemistry and the Nobel Peace Prize.' is the correct answer because it effectively highlights Pauling's unique accomplishments by mentioning both of his Nobel Prizes.
distractor_explanation: 'Linus Pauling was an American scientist known for his controversial views on nuclear disarmament.' is incorrect because it focuses on his controversial views rather than his unique accomplishments.
'Linus Pauling was awarded the 1954 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his research on chemical bonds.' is incorrect because it only mentions one of his Nobel Prizes.

'Linus Pauling's work in chemistry and his advocacy for disarmament made him famous during the Cold War.' is incorrect because it emphasizes his fame during the Cold War rather than his unique accomplishments.
